Node.definition: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which certain information becomes publicly available
= process by which a plant,or part of a plant, comes up from the ground or grows from a stalk
= young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
= the shape of (part of) the body of humans and animals; ≈ mostly used in contexts emphasizing the beauty of someone's face and figure
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= someone nobody pays attention to and/or has any interest in
literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= state in which humans are lacking physical strength, ◄ as a result of sickness or injury
literally: hiding (one's) face; hence: = causative action by which humans cover their face in order to be unable to see or be seen

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

Node.gloss: to think of|to have regard for
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans or deities consider something or someone valuable or of interest
= marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement, which is in contrast with what was assumed to be the truth earlier on
= state in which humans are lacking physical strength, ◄ as a result of sickness or injury
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well being of others
literally: wound; hence: = state in which humans experience a deep sense of grief, ◄ as if wounded in spirit
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
literally: to touch; hence: = causative action by which humans, deities or forces cause harm to humans or objects
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities inflict fatal wounds on humans or animals by making a hole in their body with a sharp object
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a human being or animal ◄ as if crushing that person with a heavy object
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by sickness or aggression; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= process by which humans recover from a wound or disease; this can also refer to the wound or disease itself

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to cause (something) to meet (someone) > to make (someone) responsible for (something)
Node.definition: literally: to cause an event to meet someone; hence: = causative action by which deities make humans responsible for an event

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to be afflicted|to be bothered|to be daunted
Node.definition: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= male or female herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns
= causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another
= female sheep; ► associated with submissiveness
= causative action by which humans cut off their hair, or the wool of a sheep or other animal

Node.gloss: to be dumb|to be unable to speak
Node.definition: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which humans are experiencing hardship imposed by others
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= all of the people born and living at about the same time

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= causative action by which objects are forcefully removed from a location, or denied access to a location

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a human being or animal ◄ as if crushing that person with a heavy object
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to lose their physical strength
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= sacrifice brought to compensate for what the deity should have received, but what was not given

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

Node.gloss: to prolong (days) > to stay long|to linger|to last|to live on
Node.definition: literally: to prolong (days); hence: = to stay (in a certain location or position) for an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= process by which an event is completed with the expected or satisfactory outcome

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to have (one's) fill > to be contented
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated; hence: = process by which the desire of humans is fulfilled
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to clear|to justify|to lead to righteousness
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make efforts to ensure that other humans are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior, either in an absolute sense or relative to someone else
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans divide an object (or range of objects) into portions and share them out among each other
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which humans or deities have physical, political, or military strength
= causative action by which humans divide an object (or range of objects) into portions and share them out among each other
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
literally: to lay one's self bare to death; hence: = state in which humans are willing to undergo death
= process by which humans or animals stop living

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well being of others
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
